rules: Rule1: Provided that the engine was assembled during the morning shift, the finished car is a complete vehicle.
Rule2: Either the suspension was assembled during the morning shift, or if the electrical system was assembled during the morning shift, then the brake system was assembled during the morning shift.
Rule3: In the case that the engine is defective, the suspension was not assembled during the morning shift.
Rule4: Whenever the transmission is assembled during the morning shift, the engine is assembled during the morning shift.
Rule5: Either the transmission was assembled during the morning shift, or the chassis was assembled during the morning shift.
Rule6: If the chassis was assembled during the morning shift, then the engine was assembled during the afternoon shift.
Rule7: Either the supervisor approved the assembly line, or the manager approved the assembly line.
Rule8: Under the condition that the manager approved the assembly line, then if the chassis being assembled does not necessitate the engine being assembled, the engine fails the quality check.
Rule9: Provided that it is not true that production target being met implies that afternoon engine assembly requires morning assembly, then overtime is not scheduled for the assembly line.
Rule10: In the case that the chassis being assembled does not imply the engine being assembled, the engine passes the quality check.

Rule11: Provided that it is not the case that supervisor approval implies that lack of chassis-engine assembly implication leads to failed quality check, then maintenance is scheduled for the assembly line.

Rule12: If it is not true that supervisor approval leads to the condition that chassis assembly not implying engine assembly results in failed quality check, then maintenance is not scheduled for the assembly line.
Rule13: If it is not the case that the negation of the previous complex condition implies weekend shift activation, then emergency maintenance occurs for the assembly line.

Rule14: Provided that it is not true that the negation of engine assembly implying interior not being assembled leads to exterior assembly, then the electrical system is assembled during the morning shift.
Rule15: In the case that the engine is not assembled during the morning shift, the interior is assembled during the morning shift.
facts: Fact2: The production target was met for the assembly line.
Fact3: The brake system was not assembled during the morning shift.
Fact4: The shift was not extended for the assembly line.
Fact5: The night shift was not activated for the assembly line.
Fact6: The weekend shift was not activated for the assembly line.
Fact7: Emergency maintenance did not occur for the assembly line.
Fact8: The exterior was not assembled during the morning shift.

question: The finished car is a complete vehicle.
